entry.title: Hugo Markdown ã§ãƒ–ãƒ­ãƒƒã‚¯è¦ç´ ã«ã‚¯ãƒ©ã‚¹å±æ€§ã‚’ä»˜ä¸ã™ã‚‹
entry.content:
Hugo 0.81 ã‹ã‚‰ã®æ©Ÿèƒ½ã‚‰ã—ã„ã®ã ãŒï¼Œ markdown ãƒ†ã‚­ã‚¹ãƒˆä¸­ã®ãƒ–ãƒ­ãƒƒã‚¯è¦ç´ ã«å¯¾ã—ã¦ class å±æ€§ã‚’ä»˜ã‘ã‚‰ã‚Œã‚‹ã‚ˆã†ã ï¼ˆgoldmark ãƒ‘ãƒ¼ã‚µã‚’ä½¿ã†å ´åˆï¼‰ã€‚ ã“ã‚Œã‚’æœ‰åŠ¹ã«ã™ã‚‹ã«ã¯ config.toml ãƒ•ã‚¡ã‚¤ãƒ«ã§

[markup.goldmark.parser.attribute]
  block = true

ã¨æŒ‡å®šã™ã‚‹ï¼ˆæ—¢å®šå€¤ã¯ falseï¼‰ã€‚ YAML (config.yaml) ã§æ›¸ããªã‚‰

entry.title: Markdown ã¨ VS Code
entry.content:
1. ãƒ‘ã‚½ã‚³ãƒ³ã« Visual Studio Code ã‚’å°å…¥ã™ã‚‹ï¼ˆå†ãƒãƒ£ãƒ¬ãƒ³ã‚¸ï¼‰
  2. Go ã¨ VS Code
  3. Markdown ã¨ VS Code â† ã‚¤ãƒã‚³ã‚³
  4. Java ã¨ VS Code
  5. ã‚„ã£ã¨ Codespaces ãŒä½¿ãˆã‚‹

ä»Šå›ã¯ VS Code ã§ markdown ãƒ†ã‚­ã‚¹ãƒˆã‚’å…¥å‡ºåŠ›ã™ã‚‹è©±ã€‚

Markdown All in One

$ code --install-extension yzhang.markdown-all-in-one

Markdown é–¢é€£ã®æ‹¡å¼µæ©Ÿèƒ½ã¯è‰²ã€…ã‚ã‚‹ã‚ˆã†ã ãŒï¼Œå…¥åŠ›æ”¯æ´ã«é–¢ã—ã¦ã¯ã“ã‚Œã§å¿…è¦ååˆ†ã½ã„ã€‚

ãŠæ°—ã«å…¥ã‚Šã¯ãƒ†ãƒ¼ãƒ–ãƒ«æ•´å½¢ã®æ©Ÿèƒ½ã§ï¼Œ Linux/Ubuntu ãªã‚‰ [Ctrl+Shift+I] ã‚­ãƒ¼ï¼ˆFormat Documentï¼‰æŠ¼ä¸‹ã§ç¶ºéº—ã«æ•´å½¢ã—ã¦ãã‚Œã‚‹ã€‚

ã¨ã“ã‚ãŒ Windows ç‰ˆã§ã¯ [Shift+Alt+F] ã‚­ãƒ¼ãŒ Format Document ã«å‰²ã‚Šå½“ã¦ã‚‰ã‚Œã¦ã„ã‚‹ã‚ˆã†ã ã€‚ ãƒ—ãƒ©ãƒƒãƒˆãƒ•ã‚©ãƒ¼ãƒ ã«ã‚ˆã£ã¦é•ã†ã®ã‹ã‚ˆã€‚

ã¨ã„ã†ã‚ã‘ã§ Windows ç‰ˆã®æ–¹ã«ã‚­ãƒ¼å‰²å½“ã‚’åˆã‚ã›ã‚‹ã“ã¨ã«ã—ãŸã€‚

// Place your key bindings in this file to override the defaults
[
    {
        "key": "shift+alt+f",
        "command": "editor.action.formatDocument",
        "when": "editorHasDocumentFormattingProvider && editorTextFocus && !editorReadonly && !inCompositeEditor"
    },
    {
        "key": "ctrl+shift+i",
        "command": "-editor.action.formatDocument",
        "when": "editorHasDocumentFormattingProvider && editorTextFocus && !editorReadonly && !inCompositeEditor"
    },
    {
        "key": "shift+alt+f",
        "command": "editor.action.formatDocument.none",
        "when": "editorTextFocus && !editorHasDocumentFormattingProvider && !editorReadonly"
    },
    {
        "key": "ctrl+shift+i",
        "command": "-editor.action.formatDocument.none",
        "when": "editorTextFocus && !editorHasDocumentFormattingProvider && !editorReadonly"
    }
]

Prettier - Code formatter ã¨ã®ç«¶åˆ

$ code --install-extension esbenp.prettier-vscode

Markdown å°‚ç”¨ã¨ã„ã†ã‚ã‘ã§ã¯ãªã„ãŒ JavaScript/TypeScript, CSS/SCSS/Less, HTML, JSON, GraphQL, YAML ãªã©å¹…åºƒã„è¨€èªã«å¯¾å¿œã—ã¦ã„ã‚‹æ•´å½¢ãƒ„ãƒ¼ãƒ«ã§ï¼Œã—ã‹ã‚‚ plugin æ‹¡å¼µã‚‚ã§ãã‚‹ã‚‰ã—ã„ã€‚ ã‚‚ã¡ã‚ã‚“ markdown ãƒ†ã‚­ã‚¹ãƒˆã«ã‚‚å¯¾å¿œã—ã¦ã„ã‚‹ã€‚

ã§ï¼Œã“ã‚Œã¨ Markdown All in One ã®æ•´å½¢æ©Ÿèƒ½ï¼ˆFormat Documentï¼‰ãŒè¢«ã‚‹ã‚ã‘ã§ã™ã‚ˆã€‚ ãã“ã§ï¼Œã©ã¡ã‚‰ã®æ©Ÿèƒ½ã‚’ä½¿ã†ã‹è¨€èªã”ã¨ã«è¨­å®šã§ãã‚‹ã‚ˆã†ã«ãªã£ã¦ã„ã‚‹ã€‚ ç§ã¯ Markdown All in One å„ªå…ˆã§ã“ã‚“ãªæ„Ÿã˜ã€‚

{
    "[markdown]": {
        "editor.defaultFormatter": "yzhang.markdown-all-in-one"
    }
}

ã•ã‚‰ã«ãƒ•ã‚¡ã‚¤ãƒ«ä¿å­˜æ™‚ã«å¤‰æ›´ã—ãŸç®‡æ‰€ã ã‘ã‚’æ•´å½¢ã™ã‚‹ï¼Œãªã‚“ã¦ãªè¨­å®šã‚‚è¨€èªã”ã¨ã«ã§ãã‚‹ã‚ˆã†ã ã€‚

{
    "[markdown]": {
        "editor.defaultFormatter": "yzhang.markdown-all-in-one",
        "editor.formatOnSave": true,
        "editor.formatOnSaveMode": "modifications"
    }
}

ã¡ãªã¿ã« EditorConfig for VS Code ãŒæœ‰åŠ¹ãªå ´åˆã¯ .editorconfig ã®è¨­å®šï¼ˆã‚¤ãƒ³ãƒ‡ãƒ³ãƒˆã‚„æ”¹è¡Œã‚³ãƒ¼ãƒ‰ãªã©ï¼‰ã‚’è€ƒæ…®ã—ã¦ãã‚Œã‚‹ã‚ˆã†ã ã€‚ ã“ã‚Œã‚’ç„¡åŠ¹ã«ã™ã‚‹ã«ã¯ â€œUse Editor Configâ€ ã®é …ç›®ã‚’ OFF ã«ã™ã‚‹ã€‚

{
    "prettier.useEditorConfig": false
}

ãŸã ã—ï¼Œ EditorConfig ãŒæœ‰åŠ¹ãªå ´åˆã§ã‚‚ .prettierrc ãƒ•ã‚¡ã‚¤ãƒ«ãªã©ã«ã‚ˆã‚‹ Prettier ç‹¬è‡ªã®è¨­å®šãŒã‚ã‚‹å ´åˆã¯ï¼Œãã¡ã‚‰ã®ã»ã†ãŒå„ªå…ˆã•ã‚Œã‚‹ã‚ˆã†ã ã€‚ ã‚„ã‚„ã“ã—ã„…

è‡ªå‹•è£œå®Œã‚’æœ‰åŠ¹ã«ã™ã‚‹

VS Code ã®å£²ã‚Šã®ã²ã¨ã¤ã¯ã‚¹ãƒ‹ãƒšãƒƒãƒˆã‚’å«ã‚€å¼·åŠ›ãªè‡ªå‹•è£œå®Œæ©Ÿèƒ½ã ãŒï¼Œä½•æ•…ã‹ markdown ãƒ•ã‚¡ã‚¤ãƒ«ã«ã¯è‡ªå‹•è£œå®ŒãŒåŠ¹ã‹ãªã„ã€‚ ã¨æ€ã£ãŸã‚‰ï¼Œæ—¢å®šã§ç„¡åŠ¹ã«ãªã£ã¦ã„ã‚‹ã‚‰ã—ã„ã€‚ ã„ã‚„ï¼Œæœ‰åŠ¹ã«ã—ã¨ã‘ã‚ˆã€‚

ã¨ã„ã†ã‚ã‘ã§ settings.json ã«ä»¥ä¸‹ã®è¨­å®šã‚’æ‰‹å‹•ã§æ›¸ãè¾¼ã‚€ã€‚

{
    "[markdown]": {
        "editor.quickSuggestions": true,
        "editor.snippetSuggestions": "top"

HTML ã¸ã®å¤‰æ›ã¯ã“ã‚“ãªæ„Ÿã˜ã«æ›¸ã‘ã‚‹ã€‚

package main

import (
	"fmt"
	"io/ioutil"
	"os"

	"gopkg.in/russross/blackfriday.v2"
)

func main() {
	md, err := ioutil.ReadFile(os.Args[1])
	if err != nil {
		fmt.Fprintln(os.Stderr, err)
		return
	}

    //HTMLFlags and Renderer
	htmlFlags := blackfriday.CommonHTMLFlags         //UseXHTML | Smartypants | SmartypantsFractions | SmartypantsDashes | SmartypantsLatexDashes
	htmlFlags |= blackfriday.FootnoteReturnLinks     //Generate a link at the end of a footnote to return to the source
	htmlFlags |= blackfriday.SmartypantsAngledQuotes //Enable angled double quotes (with Smartypants) for double quotes rendering
	htmlFlags |= blackfriday.SmartypantsQuotesNBSP   //Enable French guillemets æ (with Smartypants)
	renderer := blackfriday.NewHTMLRenderer(blackfriday.HTMLRendererParameters{Flags: htmlFlags, Title: "", CSS: ""})

	//Extensions
	extFlags := blackfriday.CommonExtensions //NoIntraEmphasis | Tables | FencedCode | Autolink | Strikethrough | SpaceHeadings | HeadingIDs | BackslashLineBreak | DefinitionLists
	extFlags |= blackfriday.Footnotes        //Pandoc-style footnotes
	extFlags |= blackfriday.HeadingIDs       //specify heading IDs  with {#id}
	extFlags |= blackfriday.Titleblock       //Titleblock ala pandoc
	extFlags |= blackfriday.DefinitionLists  //Render definition lists

	html := blackfriday.Run(md, blackfriday.WithExtensions(extFlags), blackfriday.WithRenderer(renderer))
	fmt.Println(string(html))
}

import (
	"context"

	"github.com/google/go-github/github"
)

func renderWithGitHub(md []byte) ([]byte, error) {
	client := github.NewClient(nil)
	opt := &github.MarkdownOptions{Mode: "gfm", Context: "google/go-github"}
	body, _, err := client.Markdown(context.Background(), string(md), opt)
	return []byte(body), err
}

//Render returns HTML page text with template
func (p *PageData) Render() ([]byte, error) {
	f, err := data.Assets.Open("/template.html")
	if err != nil {
		return nil, err
	}
	tmpData := &bytes.Buffer{}
	io.Copy(tmpData, f)

	t, err := template.New("Markdown Processing").Parse(tmpData.String())
	if err != nil {
		return nil, err
	}

	buf := &bytes.Buffer{}
	err = t.Execute(buf, p)
	return buf.Bytes(), err
}

Blackfriday Markdown Processor v1.5
Available at http://github.com/russross/blackfriday

Usage:

Options:
  -cpuprofile string
        Write cpu profile to a file
  -css string
        Link to a CSS stylesheet (implies -page)
  -fractions
        Use improved fraction rules for smartypants (default true)
  -latex
        Generate LaTeX output instead of HTML
  -latexdashes
        Use LaTeX-style dash rules for smartypants (default true)
  -page
        Generate a standalone HTML page (implies -latex=false)
  -repeat int
        Process the input multiple times (for benchmarking) (default 1)
  -smartypants
        Apply smartypants-style substitutions (default true)
  -toc
        Generate a table of contents (implies -latex=false)
  -toconly
        Generate a table of contents only (implies -toc)
  -xhtml
        Use XHTML-style tags in HTML output (default true)

# Go 1.8.7 ãŠã‚ˆã³ 1.9.4 ãŒãƒªãƒªãƒ¼ã‚¹

[Go è¨€èª]ã‚³ãƒ³ãƒ‘ã‚¤ãƒ©ã® 1.8.7 ãŠã‚ˆã³ 1.9.4 ãŒãƒªãƒªãƒ¼ã‚¹ã•ã‚Œã¦ã„ã‚‹ã€‚
ã“ã®ãƒãƒ¼ã‚¸ãƒ§ãƒ³ã§ã¯è„†å¼±æ€§ [CVE-2018-6574] ã®ä¿®æ­£ãŒè¡Œã‚ã‚Œã¦ã„ã‚‹ã€‚

## è„†å¼±æ€§ã®å†…å®¹

`#cgo` ãƒ‡ã‚£ãƒ¬ã‚¯ãƒ†ã‚£ãƒ–ã‚’å«ã‚€ [Go è¨€èª]ã‚³ãƒ¼ãƒ‰ã‚’ãƒ“ãƒ«ãƒ‰ã™ã‚‹éš›ã«ä»»æ„ã®å‡¦ç†ã‚’å®Ÿè¡Œã•ã‚Œã‚‹å¯èƒ½æ€§ãŒã‚ã‚‹ã€‚

> When cgo is enabled, the build step during â€œgo getâ€ invokes the host C compiler, gcc or clang, adding compiler flags specified in the Go source files.
> Both gcc and clang support a plugin mechanism in which a shared-library plugin is loaded into the compiler, as directed by compiler flags.
> This means that a Go package repository can contain an attack.so file along with a Go source file that says (for example) `// #cgo CFLAGS: -fplugin=attack.so`, causing the attack plugin to be loaded into the host C compiler during the build.
> Gcc and clang plugins are completely unrestricted in their access to the host system.

<h2>è„†å¼±æ€§ã®å†…å®¹</h2>

<p><code>#cgo</code> ãƒ‡ã‚£ãƒ¬ã‚¯ãƒ†ã‚£ãƒ–ã‚’å«ã‚€ <a href="https://golang.org/" title="The Go Programming Language">Go è¨€èª</a>ã‚³ãƒ¼ãƒ‰ã‚’ãƒ“ãƒ«ãƒ‰ã™ã‚‹éš›ã«ä»»æ„ã®å‡¦ç†ã‚’å®Ÿè¡Œã•ã‚Œã‚‹å¯èƒ½æ€§ãŒã‚ã‚‹ã€‚</p>

<blockquote>
<p>When cgo is enabled, the build step during â€œgo getâ€ invokes the host C compiler, gcc or clang, adding compiler flags specified in the Go source files.
Both gcc and clang support a plugin mechanism in which a shared-library plugin is loaded into the compiler, as directed by compiler flags.
This means that a Go package repository can contain an attack.so file along with a Go source file that says (for example) <code>// #cgo CFLAGS: -fplugin=attack.so</code>, causing the attack plugin to be loaded into the host C compiler during the build.
Gcc and clang plugins are completely unrestricted in their access to the host system.</p>
</blockquote>

GitHub ãŒ Markdown å¤‰æ›ç”¨ã® REST API ã‚’æä¾›ã—ã¦ã„ã‚‹ã‚‰ã—ã„ã€‚

æ›´ã«ã“ã® API ã‚’åˆ©ç”¨ã™ã‚‹ãŸã‚ã®ãƒ‘ãƒƒã‚±ãƒ¼ã‚¸ã‚’ Google ãŒæä¾›ã—ã¦ã„ã‚‹ã€‚

ã§ã¯ï¼Œã“ã®ãƒ‘ãƒƒã‚±ãƒ¼ã‚¸ã‚’ä½¿ã£ãŸå¤‰æ›ã‚³ãƒ¼ãƒ‰ã‚’æ›¸ã„ã¦ã¿ã‚ˆã†ã€‚ ã“ã‚“ãªæ„Ÿã˜ã‹ãªã€‚

package main

import (
	"fmt"
	"io"
	"io/ioutil"
	"os"
	"strings"

	"github.com/google/go-github/github"
)

func main() {
	md, err := ioutil.ReadFile(os.Args[1])
	if err != nil {
		fmt.Fprintln(os.Stderr, err)
		return
	}

	client := github.NewClient(nil)
	opt := &github.MarkdownOptions{Mode: "gfm", Context: "google/go-github"}

	html, _, err := client.Markdown(string(md), opt)
	if err != nil {
		fmt.Fprintln(os.Stderr, err)
		return
	}
	io.Copy(os.Stdout, strings.NewReader(html))
}
